Mobile banking is a sub-component of digital inclusive finance that allows individuals to access financial services through their mobile devices. It enables convenient and secure transactions, including deposits, withdrawals, and transfers, without the need for physical bank branches.
relations.Subject: mobile banking

relations.Description: Digital wallets are a type of digital inclusive finance tool that allows users to store, manage, and transact digital currencies. They provide a secure and convenient way to make payments, transfer funds, and store loyalty cards and coupons digitally.
relations.Subject: digital wallets

relations.Description: Microfinance is a category of financial services that falls under digital inclusive finance. It involves providing small loans, savings accounts, insurance, and other financial products to individuals and small businesses who lack access to traditional banking services.
relations.Subject: microfinance

relations.Description: Crowdfunding is a sub-component of digital inclusive finance that enables individuals and organizations to raise funds for projects or ventures through online platforms. It allows for the pooling of small contributions from a large number of people, making it an inclusive financing option.
relations.Subject: crowdfunding

relations.Description: Peer-to-peer lending is a sub-component of digital inclusive finance that connects borrowers directly with lenders through online platforms. It eliminates the need for traditional financial intermediaries, enabling individuals and small businesses to access loans at competitive rates.
relations.Subject: peer-to-peer lending
